intro: Veratrilla baillonii, commonly known as the Bailloni's larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of blue to purple flowers, which bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Veratrilla baillonii is part of the Ranunculaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like buttercups and anemones.
